result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse J. Lukitsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Misdemeanor Conviction [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.

*Engage in any counseling as recommended by the agent.
*No contact with K.K.
*Court WAIVES the DNA sample

Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Defendant Jesse J. Lukitsch in court with attorney Anne Renc. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CM-286, 15CF-433 and 15CF-246.

2:30 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea and sentencing this afternoon.

Court has received 3 Plea questionnaire/Agreement, signed by Defendant.

There is a plea agreement.

State provides to the Court a Restitution Summary.

15CM-286: Defendant will plead to Count 2. Count 1 will be dismissed and read in. State requesting 9 month jail sentence, costs, restitution of $7,064.11.
15CF-246: Defendant will plead to Count 3 and Count 4. Counts 1 and 2 will be dismissed and read in. Whld sentence, 24 mo prob.
15CF-433: Defendant will plead to Count 2. Whld sentence, 24 mo probation. Count 1 and Count 3 would be dismissed and read in. obt/mtn ft empt, other counseling, no con K. Kusch, dna sample, costs, pay restitituion in 15CM-286.

Defense is free to argue.

Atty Renc concurs.
Atty Renc did not receive the restitution summary and this is the first hearing it, is not prepared to go forward with 15CM-286 but is prepared to go forward on the other two cases.

State has no issues. 
Court will take the pleas on 15CF-246 and 15CF-433 today.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF-246: Count 3 and Count 4: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 15CF-433: Count 2: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Renc for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-246: Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-246: Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-246: Count 3: Found Guilty
15CF-246: Count 4: Found Guilty
15CF-433: Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
15CF-433: Count 2: Found Guilty
15CF-433: Count 3: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Renc makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-246:
Count 3:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for  a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Maintain full time employment
Comply with any counseling as reasonably recommended by the agent if any
No direct contact with K. K. during period of probation
Provide DNA Sample
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 4:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months concurrent to Count 3
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 3
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

15CF-433:
Count 2:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months concurrent to 15CF-246
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF-246
Pay costs 
Pay DNA Surcharge
